channel.title: Lisa Karstens on Karstens Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Lisa Karstens on Karstens Lab

item.title: Optimizing information to investigate the urobiome
item.description:
Lisa Karstens, PhD presented her group’s recent work at the Collaborating for the Advancement of Interdisciplinary Research in Benign Urology (CAIRIBU) Uromicrobiota Research Interest Group (U-RIG) in Dec 2023. You can watch her talk “Optimizing information to investigate the urobiome” on the CAIRIBU YouTube channel.

U-RIG is a monthly series for knowledge exchange and collaborations in urobiome and adjacent fields. For more information and to sign up go here.

item.title: Introducing the Human Contaminome
item.description: Lisa Karstens, PhD presented a keynote at the ICCMG conference in Geneva, Switzerland on Nov 16th 2023. Her talk entitled “Introducing the Human Contaminome” presented the current issues around contaminants in sequence based microbiome studies and reviewed the current computational solutions.The slides from her talk are available here.

item.title: Reliability and reproducibility in urobiome research – challenges and promise in investigating a low microbial biomass environment
The bladder is not the gut - Adapting methods to investigate the Urobiome
Rethinking the Role of Bacteria in the Bladder in Overactive Bladder and Urinary Incontinence
Do you see what I see? Introducing microshades, An R package for improving accessibility and organization of complex data
